dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1860 IH: Disaster Assistance Recoupment Fairness Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Meeks introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To ensure fairness in the recoupment of certain Federal disaster assistance, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Disaster Assistance Recoupment Fairness Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding section 3716(e) of title 31, United States Code, the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency may waive a debt owed to the United States related to covered assistance provided to an individual or household if—

paragraph.text: the covered assistance was distributed based on an error by the Federal Emergency Management Agency;

there was no fault on behalf of the debtor, including that there was no fraud, presentation of a false claim, or misrepresentation by the debtor or any party having an interest in the applicable claim; and
the collection of the debt would be against equity and good conscience.

subsection.header: Monitoring of covered assistance distributed based on error

paragraph.text: The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security shall monitor, on an ongoing basis, the distribution of covered assistance to determine the percentage of such assistance that is distributed based on an error by the Federal Emergency Management Agency.

paragraph.header: Removal of waiver authority due to excessive error rate
paragraph.text: If the Inspector General determines, with respect to any 12-month period, that the percentage of covered assistance that is distributed based on an error by the Federal Emergency Management Agency exceeds 4 percent of the total amount of covered assistance distributed—

clause.text: notify the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency of the determination; and
publish the determination in the Federal Register; and

subparagraph.text: with respect to debts owed in relation to covered assistance provided for a major disaster or emergency declared after the date on which the determination is published under subparagraph (A)(ii), the waiver authority under subsection (a) of this section shall not apply.

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered assistance means assistance provided—

paragraph.text: under section 408 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5174); and
in relation to a major disaster or emergency declared by the President under such Act (42 U.S.C. 5121 et seq.) on or after October 30, 2012.

section.text: Notwithstanding section 3716(e) of title 31, United States Code, the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency, unless there is evidence of fraud, shall not initiate any action, in any forum, to recover—

paragraph.text: assistance provided to an individual or household under section 408 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5174) more than 3 years after the last date on which the assistance was provided; or
amounts owed by an individual or household in relation to assistance provided under such section more than 3 years after the date on which the amounts were determined to be owed.
